txt.en: Talk to Tuhâl
Listen to the conversation
You have been tasked with infiltrating Utterby!\n\nYou should talk to Náin.
Talk to Náin
The time has come for Tuhâl of Chayasír to stand before Lord Náin and speak for the Easterling refugees.
Tuhâl is speaking to Lord Náin.\n\nYou should listen to the conversation.
'Please, Lord Náin! Your skill as a warrior is legendary, but I must speak the truth, for the sake of my people!'
'Lord Náin, I am Tuhâl of the Chayasír. I am but a refugee from the East!'
'I am not a Jangovar! I surrendered as soon as I saw an opportunity! You must believe me, the Jangovar are forcing us to work and fight under threat to our families!'
Instance: The Lord of Iron
'I have heard you plan to collapse the stair at Skald's Drop, but I implore you to reconsider! We are simple refugees, fleeing a terrible devastation!'
'We have no home to return to, and you would be damning so many innocents to a terrible fate!'
'We call that village Er Shamol. The Jangovar have imparted martial law over it.'

'I apologize for putting this on your shoulders, [placeholder], but from what I have heard, you are more than capable of this task. Keep an eye on our \qfriend\q here. His words are convincing, but I am not quick to trust any foreigner. Do what you can from within to clear the innocents out and undermine their operation. I will come to finish the task when the time is right.'
'Many innocents are there, being forced to work under terrible conditions. If you attack, they will surely die!'
'Thank you, Lord Náin! We will not waste this chance!'
TBD
'Wish me luck, friend.'
The time has come for Tuhâl of Chayasír to stand before Lord Náin and speak for the Easterling refugees.
'We have no home to return to, and you would be damning so many innocents to a terrible fate!'
'[placeholder], who is this Easterling you have brought before me? Is this one of those \qJangovar\q?'
'But you were taken prisoner for your part in the attack on Hammerstead, were you not?'

'\qJangovar\q, \qChayasir\q, it matters not to me. You are on my lands and occupying a village belonging to the Kingdom of Dale, our most important ally! Why should I not slay you where you stand for your insolence?'
'You are foolish, but I hear the desperation in your words. The Longbeards know what it is like to have no home, to be wanderers.'
'I will consider what you have said. But, something must be done about Utterby. I will NOT have these \qJangovar\q attacking my charges and stealing their craft!'
'Despite my appearance and reputation, I am not a cold-hearted monster. I will give you and [placeholder] an opportunity to remove these innocents from the situation.'
'The two of you will infiltrate Utterby. [placeholder], you will need to disguise yourself as one of these refugees. I will give you time to get the innocents out.'
'Then, I will come and deal with these interlopers myself. You had best hurry. You will not have long.'
'You dare come into my keep and tell me what I should or should not do with my own lands?!'
TBD
TBD
'I am so relieved that Lord Náin heard my words. Now, we must come up with a plan.'
